column1: Design the control scheme with learning and forgetting effects consideration

column3: Department of Marketing and Logistics Management, St. John's University, Taipei, Taiwan
column4: 2013 International Conference on Machine Learning and Cybernetics
column11: A novel quality control scheme which considers the learning-forgetting curve is proposed. In the growth stage of a new product, the fraction of nonconforming (P) is often reduced rapidly due to the repetitive production and accumulation of experience. This phenomenon of diminishing the fraction of nonconforming has significant learning effect. In addition, along with some quality improvement projects which focus on reducing the fraction of nonconforming within a specific period, the learning effect of the fraction of nonconforming is more pronounced. In order to keep the monitoring effect of the control chart, the learning effect of the fraction of nonconforming should be considered in the p quality control chart. Meanwhile, there are possible interruptions between batches in the production system which generate forgetting. In this work, the proposed p quality control chart with the learning-forgetting effect of the fraction of nonconforming in the process has practical application value. Some p control charts can be used for comparison with and without consideration of the learning-forgetting effects.

column11: Nadaraya-Watson kernel regression estimator (NWKRE) is a typical kernel regression estimator which is a kernel-based and non-parametric regression method to estimate the conditional expectation of a random variable and the non-linear mapping from input to output. For NWKRE, the selection of bandwidth, i.e., smoothing parameter h, plays a very important role in the fitting performance. In order to enhance the performance of NWKRE, an adaptive Nadaraya-Watson kernel regression estimator is proposed, ANWKRE for short. There are two main strategies to determine the adaptive or local bandwidth factor λ: geometric mean and arithmetic mean based determination methods, respectively. In this paper, we firstly investigate the mathematical properties of geometric mean and arithmetic mean in the framework of regression analysis. Then, some experimental comparisons are conducted to demonstrate our theoretical results. The experimental results find that the arithmetic mean based ANWKRE can obtain a smoother regression estimation for unknown function.

column11: Image segmentation can help us with a better understanding of the image content, and thus plays an important role in many fields of image processing including image retrieval, object recognition and image compression. We propose a novel method based on an efficient Graph-Based segmentation after analyzing its irrationalities. The proposed method with bag-of-pixels is simple and effective. In the evaluation using a large public image database that contains a lot of natural images, our method out-performs the efficient graph-based segmentation method, yields better segmentation results and shortens the running time.
